Trump's drive to deport migrants is running at full throttle
description: The White House boasted that ICE has arrested 100,000 'illegal alien criminals' in the last six months. As detention centers overflow, polls show that most Americans were not asking for such drastic action.

France says it cannot save contraceptives US plans to destroy
Jury finds Tesla partly responsible for deadly Autopilot crash case
description: Elon Musk's car company must pay more than $200 million in damages. A federal jury found that Tesla bore significant responsibility because its Autopilot technology failed, a decision that throws the company into the spotlight amid Musk's efforts to convince Americans his cars are safe enough to drive on their own.

headline: Jeffrey Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell is moved to a minimum security prison in Texas
description: No reason was given for Maxwell's transfer, though the move follows a recent, highly unusual meeting between the Epstein accomplice and a top Justice Department official. The former British socialite is serving a 20-year sentence after being convicted in 2021 of recruiting underage girls for Epstein.

headline: 'Dracula': Luc Besson's visual bloodbath filled with clichés and problematic female characters
description: The director, aiming for a sweeping romantic epic, instead delivers a film packed with clichés and visual excess.

headline: 'West Berlin became my street': Emine Sevgi Özdamar, Turkish factory worker turned actress
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (5/6). Writer, actress and theater director, the now 60-something Emine Sevgi Özdamar arrived in Germany from Turkey as a young woman to work in a factory. Very quickly, the aspiring actress discovered a new way of making theater.

Locals in Mexico City rise up against gentrification
description: Soaring rents in the Mexican capital have driven hundreds of residents into the streets to protest against property speculation, a shortage of housing and the arrival of 'digital nomads' in certain neighborhoods.

headline: In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
description: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.

headline: Call boy and ex-heroin addict, Tom B: 'In West Berlin, everyone mixed and chose their scene'
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (4/6). Tom B. came to West Berlin as a young gay man in the mid-1980s, became an escort and fell into drug addiction, just as AIDS began to strike. Now in his sixties, the sex worker and social worker has come a long way.
